DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine whether Achilles tendon debridement decompression augment flexor hallucis longus ( FHL ) tendon transfer result improve clinical functional outcome measure ankle plantar flexion strength American Orthopedic Foot Ankle Society ( AOFAS ) score compare debridement decompression alone patient 50 year age chronic insertional Achilles tendinosis . H0 : There difference ankle plantar flexion strength measure use handheld dynamometer patient randomize achilles tendon decompression debridement alone ( Group 1 ) patient randomize achilles tendon decompression debridement augment FHL transfer ( Group 2 ) . HA : Patients randomize achilles tendon decompression debridement alone ( Group 1 ) less ankle plantar flexion strength compare patient randomize achilles tendon decompression debridement augment FHL transfer ( Group 2 ) .
DOC.brief_title: Chronic Insertional Achilles Tendonitis Treated With Without Flexor Hallucis Longus Tendon Transfer
DOC.criteria: Patients 50 year age old Patients diagnose chronic insertional Achilles tendonitis Failed great 3 month conservative treatment ( activity shoe modification , heel lift , nonsteroidal antiinflammatory medication , stretch exercise , formal physical therapy ) Patients less 50 year age upon presentation Females childbearing potential Patients history ipsilateral Achilles tendon rupture History infection low extremity Patients unable undergo MRI scan
